author: mini_mads1980
title: Great Addition to the 2018 Arctic City Line
review:
Overview

A worthy addition to the 2018 Arctic sub-theme of the City sets.  I have all the theme bar the Arctic Mobile Exploration Base (60195), including the Arctic Ice Saw (30360) attached to the November 2018 issue of the National Geographic Kids magazine and this fits perfectly with all of them.

Packet

As ever the free sets on the front of the comics is a foil bag with a fold over flap keeping all the pieces secure.

Minifigure

This month (5th December 2018 to 8th January 2019) includes Explorer Eric who already appears in the Arctic Ice Saw (30360), Arctic Ice Glider (60190) and Arctic Mobile Exploration Base (60195).  It is a shame that Lego have used the same figure in so many of the smaller sets from this theme.  Indeed the three smaller sets, including the two polybags, have the same Minifigure in all of them.  So if you are on a budget you could end up with only one unique Minifig.  In recent years Lego have mixed the characters well and the numbers you would associate with City (starting 60###) have a good combination of useful Minifigures, I just feel a different one in this set would have been better.

Main Build/Parts

The finished build is well constructed, solid and plays well.  I do find Lego have, in recent years, tended to "bump" the piece count up by using two bits when one would do.  This has two examples - in less than 40 pieces!  They have used a 2x2 Bright Orange plate with a 2x6 Bright Orange plate to make a 2x8.  This could be forgiven as it the parts do sit directly on a Black 2x8 plate, however they do it again with 1x2 and 2x2 plates to make a 2x3.  There are no parts that I would describe as special and most have been used lots in the past so you are likely to be able to make your own if you have a sizable collection without needing to purchase the comic.

You also get a micro build (6 pieces) that represents ice and snow with a bone clipped on.  Unlike other Arctic sets you don't have to dig the bone out.  However, it's inclusion adds another level of playability to the set which would be lacking if this was the only Arctic set you had.

Verdict

After last months Garbageman Gary this set had a lot to live up to and although good I wouldn't recommend it unless, like me, you want all the sets in the 2018 Arctic Theme.  For me Arctic Ice Glider (60190) would be a better purchase as it is the same price (although you don't get the comic) and is a better looking vehicle in which you get exactly the same Minifigure.

Additionally the comic seems to have jumped from £3.85 for Issue 9 to £4.99 for Issue 10 (stopping it get 5 for Value for money).  This could be because you get the Issue 1 Policeman and Crook (951701), so when we return to Issue 11 on 9th January 2018 the price may have reverted.  I certainly hope so as the Mini-Jet from the new Sky Police theme looks terrible.  This is still a fantastic price for two small sets and a comic, it's just the unexpected price rise needs noting and the extra set is something I already have as I bought the original comic.
